hillbillies.model

Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Unit

  • public class Unit
extends java.lang.Object
    .... TODO: split isValidPosition in effective & in bounds
    Invariants:
  • The position of the unit must be valid
        isValidPosition(this.getPosition())
  • The length of the position array is 3 and the position is effective
        (this.position != null) && (this.position.length == 3)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Unit

        public Unit(java.lang.String name,
            int x,
            int y,
            int z,
            int weight,
            int strength,
            int agility,
            int toughness)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new unit with the given position
        Parameters:
        x - The initial x value of the position
        y - The initial y value of the position
        z - The initial z value of the position
        Postconditions:
      • If the given strength is less then 25 then the initial strength is set to 25. If the given strength is more then 100 then the initial strength is set to 100.
            if strength > 100
            then new.getStrength() == 100
            else if strength < 25
            then new.getStrength() == 25
      • If the given agility is less then 25 then the initial agility is set to 25. If the given agility is more then 100 then the initial agility is set to 100.
            if agility > 100
            then new.getAgility() == 100
            else if agility < 25
            then new.getAgility() == 25
      • If the given weight is less then 25 then the initial weight is set to 25. If the given weight is more then 100 then the initial weight is set to 100.
            if weight > 100
            then new.getWeight() == 100
            else if weight < 25
            then new.getWeight() == 25
      • If the given toughness is less then 25 then the initial toughness is set to 25. If the given toughness is more then 100 then the initial toughness is set to 100.
            if toughness > 100
            then new.getToughness() == 100
            else if toughness < 25
            then new.getToughness() == 25
        • Effects:
      • Sets the position to the middle of the block
            setPosition(x + Lc/2, y + Lc/2, z + Lc/2)
      • Sets the name
            setName(name)
      • Sets the attributes
            setToughness(toughness) && setStrength(strength)
            && setAgility(agility) && setWeight(weight)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • isValidPosition

        public static boolean isValidPosition(double x,
                                      double y,
                                      double z)
        Checks if the given position is valid
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the unit's position
        y - The y value of the unit's position
        z - The z value of the unit's position
        Returns:
        True if the given position is within the boundaries of the world
            result == ((x >= 0) && (x < X_MAX) && (y >= 0) && (y < Y_MAX) && (z >= 0) && (z < Z_MAX))

      • isValidPosition

        public static boolean isValidPosition(double[] position)
        Checks if the given position is valid
        Parameters:
        position - The position to be tested.
        Returns:
        True if the position is effective, has 3 components and is within bounds.
            result == position != null && position.length == 3 && isValidPosition(position[0], position[1], position[2])

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double x,
                        double y,
                        double z)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the position of the unit.
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the new position
        y - The y value of the new position
        z - The z value of the new position
        Postcondition:
        The new position of this unit is equal to the given position
            new.getPosition() == {x, y, z}
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given position is not valid | !isValidPosition(x,y,z)

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double[] position)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the position of the unit.
        Parameters:
        position - The new position as an array
        Effect:
        The new position of this unit is equal to the given position
            this.setPosition(position[0], position[1], position[2])
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given position is not effective | position == null

        @Basic
public double[] getPosition()
        Gets the position of the unit

      • getName

        @Basic
public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the unit

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the name of the unit
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for the unit
        Postcondition:
        The new name is the given name
            new.getName() == name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The name is not valid | !isValidName(name)

      • isValidName

        public static boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)
        Checks wether the name is valid
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be checked
        Returns:
        True if name is at least 2 characters long, starts with an uppercase letter and contains only letters, spaces and quotes.
            result == (name.length() > 2) && name.matches("[A-Z][a-zA-Z'\" ]*")

      • getWeight

        @Basic
public int getWeight()
        Returns the weight of the unit

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(int weight)
        Sets the units weight to the new weight
        Parameters:
        weight - The new weight
        Postcondition:
        If the weight is less then (strength+agility)/2, it's set to this value
            if weight < (this.strength + this.agility)/2
            then new.getWeight() == (this.strength + this.agility)/2           Otherwise if the weight is more then 200, it's set to 200
            if weight > 200
            then new.getWeight() == 200           If the weight is still less then one, it's set to one
            if weight < 1
            then new.getWeight == min(1, (this.strength + this.agility)/2)           Otherwise the weight is set to the given weight
            else new.getWeight() == weight

      • getStrength

        @Basic
public int getStrength()
        Returns the strength of the unit

      • setStrength

        public void setStrength(int strength)
        Sets the strength of the unity
        Parameters:
        strength - The new strength for the unit
        Postconditions:
      • If the given strength is less then one, the new strength is one
            if strength < 1
            then new.getStrength() == 1           If the given strength is more then 200, the new strength is 200
            else if strength > 200
            then new.getStrength() == 200           Otherwise the new strength is the given strength
            else new.getStrength() == strength
      • The weight is adapted to match the new strength
            if this.getWeight < (strength + this.agility)/2
            then new.getWeight() == (strength + this.agility)/2
            else new.getWeight() == this.getWeight()

      • getAgility

        @Basic
public int getAgility()
        Returns the agility of the unit

      • setAgility

        public void setAgility(int agility)
        Sets the agility of the unit
        Parameters:
        agility - The new agility
        Postconditions:
      • If the given agility is less then one, the new agility is one
            if agility < 1
            then new.getAgility() == 1           If the given agility is more then 200, the new agility is 200
            else if agility > 200
            then new.getAgility() == 200           Otherwise the new agility is the given agility
            else new.getAgility() == agility
      • The weight is adapted to match the new agility
            if this.getWeight < (this.strength + agility)/2
            then new.getWeight() == (this.strength + agility)/2
            else new.getWeight() == this.getWeight()

      • getToughness

        @Basic
public int getToughness()
        Returns the toughness of the current unit

      • setToughness

        public void setToughness(int toughness)
        Sets the toughness of the current unit
        Parameters:
        toughness - The new toughness
        Postcondition:
        If the given toughness is less then one, the new toughness is one
            if toughness < 1
            then new.getToughness() == 1           If the given toughness is more then 200, the new toughness is 200
            else if toughness > 200
            then new.getToughness() == 200           Otherwise the new toughness is the given toughness
            else new.getToughness() == toughness

      • getHitPoints

        @Basic
public int getHitPoints()
        Returns the current amount of hitPoints of the unit

      • setHitPoints

        public void setHitPoints(int hitPoints)
        Sets the current hitPoints to the given amount of hitPoints
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - The new hitPoints of the unit
        Precondition:
        The hitPoints must be greater or equal than 0 and smaller or equal than max hitPoints
            (hitPoints <= getMaxPoints()) && (hitPoints >= 0;)
        Postcondition:
        The new hitPoints equal the given hitPoints
            new.getHitPoints() == hitPoints

      • getStamina

        @Basic
public int getStamina()
        Returns the current amount of stamina of the unit

      • setStamina

        public void setStamina(int stamina)
        Sets the current amount of stamina to the given amount of stamina
        Parameters:
        stamina - The new amount of stamina of the unit
        Precondition:
        The stamina must be greater or equal than 0 and smaller or equal than max stamina
            (stamina <= getMaxPoints()) && (stamina >= 0;)
        Postcondition:
        The new stamina equal the given stamina
            new.getStamina() == stamina

      • getMaxPoints

        public int getMaxPoints()
        Return the maximum amount of hitPoints and stamina
        Returns:
        Returns 200*weight/100*toughness/100
            result == ceil(200*weight*toughness/10000)

      • getOrientation

        @Basic
public double getOrientation()
        Returns the current orientation

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(double orientation)
        Sets the orientation of the unit
        Parameters:
        orientation - The new orientation
        Postcondition:
        The new orientation is the same as the old orientation but between 0 and 2*PI
            new.getOrientation() == ((2*Math.PI) + (orientation % (2*Math.PI))) % 2* Math.PI
